derivation.yuyuan_name: early 17th cent. (denoting a hangman, also the gallows): from Derrick, the surname of a London hangman

entry.tran: （船舶上用的）吊杆式起货设备
entry.def: A derrick is a machine that is used to move cargo on a ship by lifting it in the air.
A derrick is a tower built over an oil well which is used to raise and lower the drill.

means.word_mean: 1. a framework erected over an oil well to allow drill tubes to be raised and lowered
2. a simple crane having lifting tackle slung from a boom
